\expandafter\def\csname CourseCode@1\endcsname{\detokenize{ECE000}}
\expandafter\def\csname CourseMarkdown@1\endcsname{\detokenize{# Semiconductor Physics
Course Code: ECE000

L-T-P-X-C: 3-0-0-0-3

Pre-requisite: ECE203 Saple corse as pre-requistie


## Course Objectives
- To understand energy band theory in solids
- To analyze intrinsic and extrinsic semiconductors
- To study carrier transport phenomena

## Course Outcomes
- CO1: Explain energy band formation in solids
- CO2: Distinguish intrinsic and extrinsic semiconductors
- CO3: Analyze carrier transport mechanisms

## CO–NBA Programme Outcomes Mapping
- CO1: PO1=3, PO2=2, PO5=1, PO11=1
- CO2: PO1=2, PO2=3, PO3=2, PO5=1
- CO3: PO1=1, PO2=2, PO3=3, PO4=2, PO5=2

## CO–Programme Specific Outcomes Mapping

- CO2: PSO1=2, PSO2=2, PSO3=1
- CO3: PSO1=1, PSO2=2, PSO3=2

## CO–ABET Student Outcomes Mapping
- CO1: SO1=3, SO2=2, SO5=1,    SO7=-
- CO2: SO1=2, SO2=3, SO3=2,    SO5=1, 
- CO3: SO1=1, SO2=2, SO3=3, SO4=2, SO5=2, SO6=-, SO7=1

## Unit 1: Semiconductor Fundamentals
### Theory Content (9 Hours)
- Energy band formation: E–k diagrams; conductors, semiconductors, insulators
- Intrinsic and extrinsic semiconductors: intrinsic semiconductors; extrinsic semiconductors; energy bands
- Doping, impurity ionization, and Fermi level: doping; impurity ionization; Fermi level
- Intrinsic and extrinsic semiconductors: intrinsic semiconductors; extrinsic semiconductors; energy bands

## Unit 2: Carrier Transport Phenomena
### Theory Content (9 Hours)
- Carrier transport mechanisms: drift; mobility; diffusion
- Carrier generation and recombination: generation mechanisms; recombination mechanisms
- Resistivity and governing equations: resistivity of doped semiconductors; sheet resistance; Poisson and continuity equations
- Intrinsic and extrinsic semiconductors: intrinsic semiconductors; extrinsic semiconductors; energy bands

## Unit 3: Mathematical Representation
### Theory Content (9 Hours)
- Signal representation: $x(t)$; $x[n]$; frequency-domain interpretation
- Current density equations: $J = qn\mu E$; drift current expression
- Intrinsic and extrinsic semiconductors: intrinsic semiconductors; extrinsic semiconductors; energy bands
- Intrinsic and extrinsic semiconductors: intrinsic semiconductors; extrinsic semiconductors; energy bands

## Unit 4: Mathematical Representation
### Theory Content (9 Hours)
- Signal representation: $x(t)$; $x[n]$; frequency-domain interpretation
- Current density equations: $J = qn\mu E$; drift current expression
- Intrinsic and extrinsic semiconductors: intrinsic semiconductors; extrinsic semiconductors; energy bands
- Intrinsic and extrinsic semiconductors: intrinsic semiconductors; extrinsic semiconductors; energy bands

## Unit 5: Mathematical Representation
### Theory Content (9 Hours)
- Signal representation: $x(t)$; $x[n]$; frequency-domain interpretation
- Current density equations: $J = qn\mu E$; drift current expression
- Intrinsic and extrinsic semiconductors: intrinsic semiconductors; extrinsic semiconductors; energy bands
- Intrinsic and extrinsic semiconductors: intrinsic semiconductors; extrinsic semiconductors; energy bands}}
